title: Jack Ma | Biography, Alibaba, & Facts | Britannica Money

quotes: From 1998 to 1999 Ma was head of an Internet company in Beijing that was backed by the Ministry of Foreign Trade and Economic Cooperation.
In order to instill confidence in online sales, Alipay was created (2003) to act as a third party in transactions.
eBay, which offered to purchase Alibaba multiple times starting in 2004.
In 2005 it attracted the attention of the American Internet portal Yahoo!
and in 2007 Alibaba.com raised $1.7 billion dollars in its initial public offering (IPO) in Hong Kong.
Ma’s intuition proved correct; by 2007 Taobao had a 67 percent market share
In 2011 Ma announced that Taobao would split into three companies
In September 2014 the Alibaba Group debuted an IPO on the New York Stock Exchange

roles.title: head of an Internet company
quotes: From 1998 to 1999 Ma was head of an Internet company in Beijing
From 1998 to 1999 Ma was head of an Internet company in Beijing
Ma persuaded his team at the ministry to go back to Hangzhou with him
Small businesses paid a membership fee to be certified as trustworthy sellers on Alibaba, with a greater fee charged to businesses that wished to sell to customers outside of China.
in 2007 Alibaba.com raised $1.7 billion dollars in its initial public offering (IPO) in Hong Kong.
That IPO was the largest ever in the United States and gave the company a market value of $168 billion
